Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2011 09:51AM BrokenHeart wrote: Girls - thank you so so much.  No one "gets" this place of horror other than you ladies here.  I won't know more until tomorrow, but my Mom was Dx with Pneumonia which the Docs feel was chronic and eventually led to almost complete respiratory failure.   She is on IV antibiotics for 4 treatments [one per day for 2 hr infusions] of the antibiotics they save only for emergencies.  She's very confused, not a good color but she DID eat a weeny bit today - which she called night.  The edema worries us, but they want her to try and get out of bed with the oxygen and try and walk with a walker.  She's understandably very scared to do this - so I have no idea what will happen, yet understand her fear - SOB to the degree she suffers it and how it was would scare anyone. Please don't everyone go thinking this will happen to you.  This is because she only has one lung - and as the beast weakens everything, it weakened her more than those of us with two lungs.   I'm putting this here so no newbies come along and think this is their fate - it isn't.  My Dad is resting, but he's a mushy soul and spends a lot of his time with my Mother - which is beautiful. Please keep praying - she is far from the stage of out of the woods yet, but I feel your prayers are helping.  I have to belive in something at the moment. Zeana xox
Posts.Title: Mother admitted from ER into Hospital BrokenHeart BrokenHeart

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2011 08:37PM BrokenHeart wrote: Dear Pee, I am with all of the women saying that no one knows their own expiration date.  Not one of us comes into the world with a stamp on us, and not ONE Doctor can state with a certainty when your time is to be.   I feel very annoyed that this was even said to you - but beg you to live life to the fullest and try and put that Docs words behind you.  YOU will know when its time, and there will be no mistaking it, but no other person has a right to give you that timeline unless asked, and even then nothing is carved in stone. I always maintain that where there is life there IS hope, and I will never deviate from that belief for any living organism be it human or animal.   Pee, please don't give up on some God-Like Dr's stupid timeline.  The brain is a mighty powerful organ. Many Hugs and Prayers for you, Zeana xox
Posts.Title: Seems as if time is running out... pee vision2020

Posts.Content: BrokenHeart wrote: Hi ladies, We are currently waiting on the results of scans my Mother had last week - the week long wait is horrid.  I have scanxiety by proxy!!! She did as she said she would and took the Xeloda with the attitude "I will die trying to fight", and at 77 y/o what she did was very brave. Having said that, my Mother is rather naughty - she was given some prednisone for her lung [she only has one] as she couldn't breathe without it.  She says its asthma, my Dad says its from radiation - we daughters fear it is the Beast.  The medical profession say nothing - as far as I know my Mother has requested not to know. She won't come off the prednisone, and her original 10mg a day has been increased by her to 20mg a day in 2 weeks.  This concerns me as regards what the actual steroids could do to her - and yet on the other hand without them she can barely breathe.   I know most of my Mothers treatment is palliative, I don't know if steroids are now. Do any of you know about this doseage used longterm?   I just tend to feel if she can go from 10-20mg so fast, how long before she goes to 30mg, and yet I don't want her to suffer. This is all so confusing and frightening at the same time.   Mum is ER+PR+HER DX 1989 IDC Stage 0 ::: Stage IV mets to lung Dx 1999 - 2010 mets to bone and liver:2011 - Liver Failing - End Stage Care Only: My beautiful mother passed away 8/15/2011 Dx 5/15/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting On Scans - My Mother BrokenHeart BrokenHeart

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2010 11:15PM BrokenHeart wrote: Lisa, thank you for your kind reply.   My Mother has been treated for pneumonia but to no avail.  Only the steroids help her, and with only one lung this worries all of us - there is no other to fall back on, and sadly she will not see a pulmonologist as she says "I have the head onc of the center and she knows everything."  I get upset at that because no one can know everything, but my Mother feels safe with this onc, so it's not up to what I feel.  My Dad is told to keep quiet by my Mother - so there is little point in getting him into trouble, and he does. :) My Mother's appt is next Thurs - and she will wait out until then - that's how she is. I'm grateful for the info you have shared because at 77, I don't think I need worry about the steroids for my Mother.  In many ways I want her comfortable at all costs.   She has said she no longer cares about the cancer; just quality of life - but I did personally fear the steroids could take that QOL away. Thank you so much.  I am praying that Xeloda has zapped the beast from her liver. Please take care of yourself - I read your posts a lot. :)   Hugs, Zeana
Posts.Title: Waiting On Scans - My Mother BrokenHeart BrokenHeart

Posts.Content: BrokenHeart wrote: Hello Ladies, I  came here to thank you all - those passed away and those of you who are still fighting.  The information, care and kindness you all showed me has touched my heart deeply. My Mother passed away a week ago under palliative sedation after her extremely long battle with this beast. I also want to tell each of you something - my Mother was in stage IV for over 11 years and apart from a few weeks of Xeloda and Femara she had no chemo - she didn't want it.  Instead she chose a natural path for many years and deep in my heart I believe it served her far better than the en masse chemicals.  I didn't always think this way - I used to feel quite angry that she had never had the "big chemo" - but she had life on her terms and that's the way it is.  That path is not for everyone - but it was her way. The saddest part was the removal of her lung without a biopsy.  It made her suffering intensely worse than anyone with 2 lungs [we were told this at the end], and I know she would have wanted me to tell anyone not to have your lungs surgically touched until they have done a biopsy if at all possible. But 11+ years was a long time, so if anything - never, ever give up hope.  Choose your own path and live by it.  I certainly will if I get BC. I miss my Mom so much - everything is so unreal - I can't accept she is gone, but in her passing I learnt so much. No one is too old, too young, too anything to die of this beast I hate and loathe with my very being.  Hearing my two year old nephew sob hysterically over the loss of his Nanna was equal to the loss of any child for a Mother.  Age is no barrier to loss.  Children die of this wretched disease in other forms - this animal called Cancer knows no bounds and part of me refuses to believe that medical science cannot do more than it is. My Mother told us to to be happy - she was so beautiful inside and out - I cannot find that part called 'happy' as yet - only wretched waves of tears and denial and an emptiness no one can fill. Thank you.  Thank you.  You all helped me so much and if I had a magic wand I would wash and rid this planet of this beast. Please never give up hope!!! With love and hugs, Zeana xxx Mum is ER+PR+HER DX 1989 IDC Stage 0 ::: Stage IV mets to lung Dx 1999 - 2010 mets to bone and liver:2011 - Liver Failing - End Stage Care Only: My beautiful mother passed away 8/15/2011 Dx 5/15/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My Mother Is Sleeping Now BrokenHeart marieibrahim

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2010 11:09AM BrokenHeart wrote: Robin, your good news made me cry with happiness for you!!!  If that is what 1 treatment will do for you - well you just keep it up girl.  Enjoy your time away! ~Zeana xxxx
Posts.Title: The prognosis in not good RobinWendy BrokenHeart

Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2011 09:46PM BrokenHeart wrote: Girls, thank you so much for not judging my rant.  Right now my Mother needs all the prayers she can get.  This time it will take more than one miracle.  Please.......please send up a prayer for my Mother Brenda.  I love her so much.
Posts.Title: Mother admitted from ER into Hospital BrokenHeart BrokenHeart

Posts.Content: BrokenHeart wrote: My Mother was admitted into hospital with severe breathing problems [worse than before] despite the medication. My sister spotted the results of her EKG/ECG and the Doctor had written "abnormal result".  Blood tests show an infection, but they can't find where - we are worried it is now her heart.  Her upper back where she had rads to the spine is causing a lot of pain - but that could be heart. Her color is greyish and oxygen levels were way down.  I feel so scared - scared for her - scared for my Father who had chest pains yesterday - scared for my sisters.  It's like all there is is fear.  We thought she had come to a place of moderate QOL given her situation, but it's all gone just like that. Scared is not really the word - its more like a terror that keeps happening and I see no sense in why such lovely women get this d*amn awful disease.  I hate it.  Loathe it.  I feel like my faith is going down the drain and that we are all experiements in a petri dish --- I'm so sorry, just ranting and sounding stupid and not caring anymore and no one knows the hell of how do you help a woman who has one lung because doctors removed the other one by mistake????  No one need reply.  I'm just letting it out where I feel safe because there really IS nowhere else.  I said to my husband that if my Mother passes from cardiac, they will say she was a BC survivor they cured.   What a joke - but that happens as you all know. Hugs to everyone - big hugs because this hurts so much I hurt for all women and it feels like too much pain. Zeana Mum is ER+PR+HER DX 1989 IDC Stage 0 ::: Stage IV mets to lung Dx 1999 - 2010 mets to bone and liver:2011 - Liver Failing - End Stage Care Only: My beautiful mother passed away 8/15/2011 Dx 5/15/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mother admitted from ER into Hospital BrokenHeart BrokenHeart

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2011 10:32AM - edited Aug 27, 2011 11:22AM by BrokenHeart Dearest Ladies, I would love to thank each and every one of you individually but alas this subject is still very painful for me and by the end the replies would be a mess.   However, I thank you from the bottom of my heart for the well wishes, condolences and words of comfort, not just from me but from all my family. There is one person who deserves a mention in all this - that's My Hero Daddy Boy close on 80 who personally was my Mother's caregiver, husband, nurse, lover, and just everything rolled into one person I am so proud to call My Father.  Many men far younger than he struggle with what he did, and all after a heart attack, heart surgery and a stroke.  He stayed that distance, and it was so beautiful it hurts.  I have to say the greatest thing a man can do for his children is love their Mother - in sickness and in health.   Love is a verb and my Father proved it.   Now he has five daughters to watch out for him - and we do, and he still manages to give us his love even though his world is totally shattered.  He's the best!!!! My heart goes out to each of you who struggle with this beast - but I still say what I said to my Mother 'Where there is life there is hope', and there was for quite a time. For those of you who have lost a parent - yes, you know how it feels on this side of things, and I have so much empathy for each of you - it is a rough road to walk, but what choice do we have but the hope of one day seeing our loving parent/s again. I send warm healing hugs to all of you - none of you are ever forgotten by me so you may have to put up with me!!! With love and hope, Zeana
Posts.Title: My Mother Is Sleeping Now BrokenHeart marieibrahim

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2011 09:43AM BrokenHeart wrote: This is heartbreaking news and I offer Mr Bopeep and all family and friends my deepest condolences.   Bopeep was a woman I was instantly drawn to as were so many others.  I must admit I sensed she put on a brave and beautiful face for the rest of the world, but that only made her more endearing.  I'm so very sad and utterly shaken to read this.  So deeply sorry. ~Zeana

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2010 08:20AM BrokenHeart wrote: Peggy, I have had that from shoulder bursitis, and mine did swell lower in the arm, like a lipoma, but they diagnosed me with bursitis and synovial fluid excess.  It's very soft like Apple says.   The pain levels could keep me awake at night - it easily exceeded childbirth, so please don't think BC straight away.  I would try some ice and heat and see if either one helps your Mom. Hugs to you and your Mom, Zeana

I hope you never get BC!!!

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2010 04:34PM BrokenHeart wrote: njwall, I am so sorry you are going through all this, but I will speak from the point of view of a grown daughter who has a Mom with stage IV BC.  I would be totally horrified if my Mom thought of stopping treatment to save on finances.  I would rather go broke and pay for her treatment that have her do that.  Please, don't do this to yourself, and please don't do this to your children - not even grown ones.   If you were stopping treatment through free choice that is different, but over money?  Oh no - please don't.   The ladies above have excellent resources mentioned - and you are worth it.  Zeana xox

Just be there for her - it's easy to see you love her. Hugs, Zeana xox

Unless some stand against what normal people know, no one will ever know the truth, and stage IV will always remain unacceptable. It is enough!

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2010 01:16PM BrokenHeart wrote: The blog posting I am doing - well I changed the way I'm going about it.  I made a first posting asking "What is Stage V Cancer?"  I aked that they not use google and do not copy anothers answer as they may answer wrongly.   NO one is answering this on my blog - it is linked to my FB business page - and they are thus far admitting they do not know what it is. No typos, ladies.  I deliberatly used Stage "V" - their answers thus far show the ignorance.  I also did not say breast cancer as yet as most know I am very emotional over it and sadly don't think I can be objective AND have emotions! Must I be objective?  They will find out next post that there is no need for me to post objectively about a subject that touches the lives of so many women, and I have NO intent on posting the prettiest of pictures.  BTW - I loathe pink.   I have little respect for it.

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2010 05:41AM BrokenHeart wrote: So good to see you posting, Robin.  I'm so sorry you were stuck in the hospital so long, but now you're home, and home is a good place to spend your time resting and kicking the butt of cancer!!!   Sening you warm thoughts, prayers and hugs. ~Zeana
Posts.Title: RobinWendy katie11 Lowrider54

Posts.Content: Dec 25, 2010 05:01PM BrokenHeart wrote: Elizabeth - thank you.  I am glad it wasn't me overreacting.  It just hit me that she seems like she's wanting to make money from BC. The post she made to me was also sent to me privately, and I just thought "she doth protesteth too much".  She doesn't get it at all! My Mom is still around and has sweetly apologized to all of we daughters that she cannot support us in our grief.  That's her humor :) Hugs back at you!!! Payton - what I disliked so much was the lack of faces on the images.  As far as I know we all have a face - it just really got to me, and normally I post very little there. Good for you at getting rid of your pink cart - I do dislike the pink.  It's so scewed in its message - never representing the full picture. Thank you for the welcome back.  I acted out of emotions - I should have just shut up and taken a break. :)  Hugs to you!! Apple -  LOL.  Well, that's modern art. *splutter* :=)) Fitz, it was more than the pink I found offensive - it was the facelessness of the victims.  I find them a misrepresentation of fact. Cathy, Very true - but I don't think those paintings will fetch enough to make another herceptin - Revlon is a multi-billion $ affair, but I accept your point, too. Medigal, you are seeing what I saw and reacted to!  We all feel like that on certain days, but we still have faces and are not slimy pink things.  I sure as h*ll don't see my Mom in that light - not even at her worst times. Everyone here is still a woman with a body and a face and how she made women with BC appear repulsed me. Ugh! Peggy, thanks for the welcome back :)  I did get mad at that woman.  I sensed she wanted to make a name for herself from BC.  I relate to what your Mother did for BC and have donated works of my own to the cause - but they were women who looked like women - not like - well, read Medigal's post - she said it better than me!  Jeanne, yes, you "got it" too.  The artist has NO concept of this disease either from the point of view of the victim or as someone who is going to lose a loved one to this disease. I do not feel you are speaking just for yourself - how can any woman accept what happens to them with BC on a physical level?  The emotional and physical are synonymous. Medigal, the ones I donated to causes were of normal tasteful partial nudes - no more than a back showing or something, but always with a beauty that NO disease takes away.  Women are women and not something out of a jello box. Ugh. Shan, thank you so much.  My Mom is hanging in here at the moment!  I am feeling not so bad seeing that many of you felt as I did, or similar.  I was polite to her on forum, but it isn't what I felt.  Sometimes the freedom some artists take to express themselves knows no moral boundaries - and hers come under that category for me.  I hope she does cough up the donation $'s as well. Karma, Exactly - she's missing the whole point.  I can't believe she wrote that she had family members who had had BC - yet still she cannot "get it".  It makes me wonder where her feelings of humantity are. Dream - I agree with you entirely.  The general artist who has been at the game for a few years donates the "original" to an organization - he/she herself get no money first, and doesn't want it. Lowrider, that is how I sense it - it's a way for her to sell her art and not a heartfelt expression of humanity.  I could be wrong, but why not donate the paintings?  That seems a more honest way to me. I detest the facelessness.  That part gets to me probably more than the pink. lago, I already thought that :=)) Apple - the positive comments are the general style of comments no matter what a work is like - most good artists don't post work up there in the manner she did - she wanted attention, and she got it. MHP, I know - but that's the way some artists are headed - sadly IMO. lago, thank you so much, but I have much improvements to make myself.:) Lisa, thank you.  My mothers were taken with a cell phone camera, but I wish my sister had photographed them better.  Both my Mom and I make art from the heart - not out of any other reason.  I cannot relate the other woman's art to BC - and when I saw she related the faceless creatures to BC - I did see red! :) mrsnjband, I think we as women find breast cancer an ugly disease because it threatens not only our lives but at first our very femininity which is part of a woman's identity.  Whether it is a realistic issue or an emotional issue is not important - because people with humanity still see women as women regardless of BC. Well, that's my take on it - and I could well be wrong. _______________ Huge Hugs and Prayers to all of you ~Zeana xoxox
Posts.Title: I know I said goodbye but VERY angry and upset.. BrokenHeart motherofpatient

Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2011 10:26AM BrokenHeart wrote: We are all so small and insignificant when we look at world events, but for each person in Japan, that would be their own nightmare within each individual as much as cancer is to all of us in one way or another -  I don't think we can trivialise any traumatic events - trauma and suffering are horrific no matter what.  I guess I am trying to say please don't make small of your own suffering ladies. You have all my empathy, Zeana

Other than that my Mom is very very ill, but holding at very ill and still on Oxygen 24/7.  Her xray report said "Liver Mets", "Bone Mets", some other mets, and then "Pneumonia" with a "??" by it.  My sister saw these, not me.  It seems they question the pneumonia as being what it appeared to be but as she is on palliative/hospice home care, she is having no treatments.  But the Lung Descension is a puzzle.  :\ Zeana Mum is ER+PR+HER DX 1989 IDC Stage 0 ::: Stage IV mets to lung Dx 1999 - 2010 mets to bone and liver:2011 - Liver Failing - End Stage Care Only: My beautiful mother passed away 8/15/2011 Dx 5/15/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2010 03:40PM BrokenHeart wrote: Peggy, I am sad you were told this, because there is always hope with liver involvement settled and mets to the bone.  No one can, or should at this stage place an expiration date on your Mom.  I know your Mom is a fighter, and I don't feel she will give up that easily.  I'm not trying to give any false hopes to you - but with my own Mother - who is now down to a walking frame, albeit with difficulty - they both are so alike; neither are going to quietly walk off this planet.  I refuse to accept expiration dates - we are all dying. Please don't let go of that hope - and remember your Mom's wonderful fighting spirit.  Our mothers may scare us at times, but look how they keep surviving.  It's their fighting spirit. Many thoughts and hugs to you and your Mom,  I do know how you feel, Zeana
Posts.Title: Who do I believe? sincitydealer sincitydealer

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2010 02:25PM - edited Aug 27, 2010 02:27PM by BrokenHeart Peggy, I am so happy to read that they are scanning her - and I suspect the radium shot was for a good reason.  One thing I was told was that as women get much older [our mother's ages at least] that if the BC is hormone receptive it is nowhere near as aggressive as when we are younger - which gives our Mom's better chances than many other women, including ourselves if we contracted BC now.  Theirs can cause complications faster due to age, but the actual BC's are far slower to grow. They are also treatable and need far lower doses than younger women! I get so mad at how docs want to give up on aged women who want to fight - I get really annoyed over this.  They have NO right to deny a woman who wishes to fight a right to life.  My Mother has said she will die trying to beat it.  She scares me, but now I admire and love her spirit.  I have to believe some good will come about for both our Mom's.  We know it won't be forever, but it isn't for any living person with or without BC.  I just want them both to have some QOL - just so they smile again..........  you know what I mean. Fighting daughters are good daughters.. :)  We love our Mom's, and they know it, so keep being a 'pest'......it's kind of called love. Zeana
Posts.Title: Who do I believe? sincitydealer sincitydealer

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2010 09:06AM BrokenHeart wrote: Take care of the insides with the suggestions given, but on Vagifem I had a fibroid grow so my PCP switched me to Estriol cream and stated Estriol is the safest estrogen.  Estradiol is highly suspicious. Anyways, if you can get vagina etc all healthy, try a lotion that contains topical l-arginine.   That will warm things up a little.  Peri hit my mojo very hard and being extreme high risk for BC [I virtually await my turn] I am very careful about any Estrogens. Please ladies, read up about Estriol versus Estradiol. Barb, bleeding is not on.  I would really push that issue with your med team.  Be well everyone! ~Zeana
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain Ok, but chemo vagina? Help!!!! Shanagirl BlondiShanagirl

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2010 12:10PM BrokenHeart wrote: Smiling Spirit, I found a link that will give the idea of what l-arginine does without me getting banned for being too explicit. http://www.ehow.com/how_5709600_use-cream-arginine.html Think warmth and lots of tingles.  It does work for intimacy with a partner - sort of gets you in the mood if your body is struggling, but you may need to try a few brands until you get one that works for you.  A gf that put me onto it gave me a brand name but it did nothing for me.  I tried another and voila. :)
